image.altText: A phone screen showing social media apps.

props.synopsis: The High Court of Australia agrees to hear a special case brought by two teenagers challenging the federal government's upcoming social media ban for Australians under 16.

title.children: High Court agrees to hear teens' challenge to social media ban

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man is sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter, after the ACT Court of Appeal overturned his murder conviction for the death of his partner.

title.children: Canberra man sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter of partner

image.altText: A man with short blonde hair and glasses stands outdoors looking slightly confused.

props.synopsis: After being named leader of the Canberra Liberals last month, Mark Parton announces a reshuffled shadow cabinet after Leanne Castley stepped down from the role.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Mark Parton announces new shadow cabinet

image.altText: Cartoon of Anthony Albanese sitting alone in the Speaker's chair in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The annual showcase of the year's top political cartoons has opened at Old Parliament House in Canberra, depicting the biggest national and global events with satire and wit.

title.children: 'A lot to poke fun at': The best political cartoons of 2025

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks away as a TV camera films him.

props.synopsis: With his defamation appeal dismissed and legal costs rising, Bruce Lehrmann is almost out of options. A High Court bid is possible, but what would it take to get there?

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann is running out of courts to continue his legal battle

image.altText: A Qantas Boeing 737-800 aircraft is seen landing at Sydney Domestic Airport

props.synopsis: A data-entry mistake by a Qantas employee set off a series of errors that caused a Boeing 737 to take off slower than it should have.

title.children: Typing error 'cascaded' into series of mistakes on Qantas flight

image.altText: A person in an Akubra hat silhouetted against an Indigenous flag.

props.synopsis: Senior ACT public servants will soon be required to demonstrate their work towards ending the inequality experienced by First Nations people.

title.children: ACT public servants legally required to uphold 'Closing the Gap principle'

image.altText: 25-year-old Canberra man charged with multiple counts of dangerous driving

props.synopsis: A Canberra man has been jailed over a string of road rage attacks committed "for trivial reasons", and fined $10,000 for performing a Nazi salute outside a Queensland synagogue.

title.children: Canberra man who performed Nazi salute jailed over road rage incidents

image.altText: The sign for School of Music adorns a concrete building, winter trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has abandoned a controversial plan to absorb its School of Music into a single course after extraordinary public pressure.

title.children: ANU backflips on plan to axe the School of Music after public pressure

image.altText: Mitchell Starc is illuminated by the floodlights at the Gabba

props.synopsis: A day of tough, fluctuating Test cricket kickstarts the Ashes series at last as Mitchell Starc and Joe Root carry their sides despite concerns about what lies beneath.

title.children: Saved by Starc, Australia's selection gamble exposes its underbelly

image.altText: A close up portrait of a female Pacific Islander looking to the side with her face in profile

props.synopsis: Pacific Islanders have been leaving Australia's guest worker scheme, a decision that breaches their visa conditions and leaves them "extremely vulnerable".

title.children: Thousands have left Pacific worker scheme and are stuck in visa limbo

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: Working from home can positively impact the mental health of Australian men and women in different ways, according to a new study of more than 16,000 people.

title.children: Analysis of 16,000 people shows how working from home impacts mental health

image.altText: ADHD thumbnail

props.synopsis: International Day of People with Disability scholar Mark du Potiers shares how attention deficit hyperactivity disorder impacts him day-to-day and what he does to make life more manageable.

title.children: Living with ADHD can feel like fighting your own brain. Here's how I manage it

image.altText: Tim Wilson speaks in parliament house.

props.synopsis: The Liberals argue Labor's industrial relations concessions to the unions are a "handbrake on productivity" but this area has been tricky for the Coalition since John Howard's disastrous overreach.

title.children: Industrial relations are tricky for the Liberals since John Howard's disastrous overreach

image.altText: US defense secretary pete hegseth smirks at the camera

props.synopsis: The 84-page report finds US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated policy and could have put American troops at risk when he used the Signal app to discuss military strikes in Yemen.

title.children: Pentagon watchdog releases report on Hegseth's use of Signal app

image.altText: Yasser Abu Shabab wears a combat vest and holds a rifle as he sits and poses for a picture.

props.synopsis: Gaza militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab, whose anti-Hamas group had been supported by Israel, has been killed after an attack in southern Gaza.

title.children: Israel-aligned anti-Hamas militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab killed

image.altText: People at beach

props.synopsis: The burst of heat is short and sharp in southern states, sending temperatures more than 10 degrees Celsius above average and raising fire dangers to extreme, with the heat to linger into next week in the northern outback.

title.children: Broad heatwave spreads across the country, hottest summer on the cards

image.altText: Mr Butler speaks in front of a beige wall.

props.synopsis: Mark Butler says social media platforms have five days to "get their act together" amid reports some children are already evading the upcoming social media ban. Follow live.

title.children: Social media platforms must 'get their act together' ahead of ban, minister says

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: McIntosh says communications minister shouldn't have 'left her post' for UN trip
Australia to make guided multiple-rocket missiles: Conroy
Conroy rejects suggestion new defence agency is a 'DMO Mark II'

image.altText: A raccoon is seen passed out on a bathroom floor, in between a black bin and a white toilet.

props.synopsis: Think you have had your ears to the ground? It's time to test your knowledge of the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Blacked-out raccoon, poor strategy call and the PM's wedding

image.altText: A black and white photo of two men pouring alcohol down a drain.

props.synopsis: Prohibition was officially repealed on December 5, 1933. But the beginning of its end can be traced back years earlier — to a highly-publicised massacre by firing squad.

title.children: America's bizarre experiment with Prohibition likely ended with a brutal massacre

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: From a send-up of Hollywood studios to a chilling depiction of violence and masculinity to an age-appropriate reality TV romance, these are our favourite TV shows of 2025.

title.children: The 10 best TV shows that kept us glued to our screens in 2025

image.altText: A cylandrical military device on sandy ground

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force's bomb disposal squad responds to about 500 unexploded ordnance incidents a year, with many of the devices washing up on beaches.

title.children: Unexploded military devices washing up on beaches 'all over Australia'

image.altText: A woman smiling

props.synopsis: A UK public inquiry concludes that Russian President Vladimir Putin "must have" ordered the Novichok nerve agent attack on Russian double agent Sergei Skripal in 2018.

title.children: Putin bears 'moral responsibility' for 2018 poisoning of UK woman, inquiry finds

image.altText: The outside of a court building in a CBD.

props.synopsis: Three lawyers will face Australian legal regulators, with one ordered to pay $10,000 in costs, after submitting a legal document prepared with artificial intelligence and found to contain "inaccurate and misleading references".

title.children: Lawyers to face regulators after AI was used for court document

image.altText: Tasmania AFL licence press conference

props.synopsis: When it comes to the Macquarie Point stadium in Tasmania, there is clearly something deeper at play than seats, concrete and a roof. You simply couldn't vote for it otherwise, writes Chris Rowbottom.

title.children: Those of faith build a cathedral. Footy-mad Tasmanians build a stadium

image.altText: OpenAI signs deal with UNSW

props.synopsis: The company that brought AI into household vernacular is launching in Australia today. It comes as other companies like Meta are struggling to make traction in this space. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ChatGPT's owner OpenAI launching in Australia

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: NextDC inks data centre agreement with OpenAI
ChatGPT's owner OpenAI launching in Australia
Market now 'fully pricing' in RBA rate hike in 2026

image.altText: Marc Pfister, Christian Haller, Alan Frei and Enrico Pfister hug

props.synopsis: The idea of the Philippines curling team reaching the Winter Olympics has a hint of Cool Runnings about it, while one team member, Alan Frei, has more than a suggestion of Eddie the Eagle. But at the heart of this story is a genuine sporting fairytale that is one step away from becoming an Olympic legend.

title.children: Curling's most unlikely fairytale on the cusp of Olympic spot

image.altText: Men in uniiform hand lifejackets to other men on a boat moored on orange sand.

props.synopsis: A group of six Chinese nationals are detained by authorities after two of their group were found in WA's remote Kalumburu community by an off-duty police officer.

title.children: Chinese nationals discovered in remote WA as ABF launch investigation

image.altText: A person in a hoodie carries an item around the corner of a building.

props.synopsis: The arrest marks the first time investigators have settled on a suspect in an act that had long vexed law enforcement and spawned a multitude of conspiracy theories.

title.children: FBI arrests suspect over pipe bombs planted on eve of 2021 US Capitol riot

image.altText: A graphic of a houses under a dollar sign

props.synopsis: Thousands more properties have fallen under Queensland's land tax regime, as the state is projected to raise hundreds of millions in extra revenue each year from the charge.

title.children: Thousands more Queensland properties subject to land tax as net widens

image.altText: A woman holds up a glass container with small fishes inside, her face seen through the glass and water

props.synopsis: Golf courses around the world feature picturesque water ponds as a challenging hazard for players to avoid, but scientists are diving right in. They say golf club wetlands are an ecological safe haven to repopulate threatened native fish.

title.children: Scientists say golf course wetlands are the future for breeding threatened native fish

image.altText: A cold supermoon rises behind the Galata tower

props.synopsis: The final supermoon of the year is set to delight stargazers tonight. Here's how to spot it.

title.children: How to see the last supermoon of the year from your city

image.altText: A police vehicle at night

props.synopsis: Police are looking for a man who escaped custody in a medical gown and handcuffs in Adelaide's western suburbs, and are warning the public not to approach him.

title.children: Manhunt underway in Adelaide for man in cuffs and hospital gown

image.altText: Christine Mann standing smiling in front of a leafy green tree.

props.synopsis: A lack of access to clean clothes and sheets led to high rates of heart disease in this outback Queensland town. But an Indigenous-led washing initiative is changing health outcomes in the region.

title.children: From 99 to 15 cases: How outback region reduced preventable disease

image.altText: Two men shake hands in front of an airplane on the tarmac of an airport

props.synopsis: The Russian leader's first state visit to India in nearly four years is expected to focus heavily on trade amid a backdrop of international sanctions and Donald Trump's tariff policy.

title.children: What does Vladimir Putin want from India?
